attributes.action: Open the DIY stores in the same manner as the Supermarkets
attributes.additional_details: All DIY stores are operating a click and collect policy, however this is not being very successful. The stores could be open as the area coverage is in the same format at Supermarkets.  The restrictions could be the same and social distancing could be applied.  The benefit would provide access to materials for work to be completed at home and at the same time enable activities to relieve an unnecessary boredom.
attributes.background: I understand the need for distancing at this time, I totally agree with the reasoning.  However during these hard times of a lockdown families are at home full time, as this is the case a lot of my friends wish to carry out work within the gardens and in their homes. Access to equipment would help.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has added homeware, building supplies and hardware stores to the list of businesses which can open: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close-guidance

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
